com.team.shared.engine.engine

Class Engine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.team.shared.engine.engine.Engine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Engine
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Main Engine of the program.
    • Stores the data of the program.
    • Manages all commands given.
    Version:
    2.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • checkValidUsers

        public static void checkValidUsers(EngineCollection<java.util.List<User>,User> collectionToCheck,
                                   Stocks stocks)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        this method checks whether there is an ambiguity and validity in the users Collection:
        • checks for an ambiguity in the name(s) of the users
        • checks whether the symbol(s) of the stocks provided are truly stocks symbol(s) that already in the Engine.

        Note: this must be invoked only after the checkValidStocks(EngineCollection) has been invoked on the given Stocks, and determined them as valid.

        checking equality of the Item(s) Symbol with the Stock Symbol with case-sensitive.

        Parameters:
        collectionToCheck - the collection to check.
        stocks - the Stocks to compare each Users Holdings validity with.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - with an appropriate message in case of an invalid occurrence.

      • calcOrdersOfASingleStock

        public static void calcOrdersOfASingleStock(AfterExecutionOrderAndTransactionDTO afterExecutionOrderAndTransactionDTO,
                                            Stock stock,
                                            Order arrivedOrder)
        The Engine's core method.

        This method checks a single Stock (by passing its Symbol as a parameter), reads all its Order(s) lists, and calculates whether it is possible to create a Transaction between two Order(s).

        Explanation of local variables:

        • List buyOrders / sellOrders Get the 'Buy' Orders Collection, and the 'Sell' Orders Collection, sorted by desiredLimitPrice/timeStamp priority: Orders are sorted with the highest desiredLimitPrice at the top (= first), and the lowest desiredLimitPrice at the bottom (= last). Upon finding that prices are equal, they are sorted by timeStamp priority.
        • AtomicBoolean arrivedOrderWasTreated Update here whether the 'arrivedOrder' was treated in part or in its entirety.
        • AtomicLong serialTime Store here the serial time of the 'added' Order/Transaction. Important: must initialize with "1", so that it will be indicated that if an Order has a serialTime value of "0" it would mean that the Order is NOT a 'remained order'.

        Parameters:
        afterExecutionOrderAndTransactionDTO - the DTO/Container that saves the Orders and Transactions made after an order-execution.
        stock - the stock the user wishes to check.
        arrivedOrder - place here the last placed Order of in the stock's data-base. this means, that on the calculation process of interaction between two opposite already placed orders, this last placed order would match the desiredLimitPrice placed in another opposite already placed order. thus means, the Transaction's desiredLimitPrice would be determined by the opposite already placed order desiredLimitPrice.
        See Also:
        checkForOppositeAlreadyPlacedOrders(com.team.shared.engine.data.stock.Stock, java.util.List<com.team.shared.engine.data.order.Order>, com.team.shared.engine.data.order.Order, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong), makeATransaction(com.team.shared.engine.data.stock.Stock, com.team.shared.engine.data.order.Order, com.team.shared.engine.data.order.Order, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong), checkRemainders(com.team.shared.engine.data.stock.Stock, java.util.Iterator<com.team.shared.engine.data.order.Order>, com.team.shared.engine.data.order.Order, com.team.shared.engine.data.order.Order, com.team.shared.engine.data.transaction.Transaction, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong), checkOppositeAlreadyPlacedOrderRemainder(java.util.Iterator<com.team.shared.engine.data.order.Order>, com.team.shared.engine.data.order.Order, com.team.shared.engine.data.transaction.Transaction), checkArrivedOrderRemainder(com.team.shared.engine.data.stock.Stock, com.team.shared.engine.data.order.Order, com.team.shared.engine.data.transaction.Transaction, java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicLong)

      • calcDesiredLimitPriceOfMKTOrder

        public static long calcDesiredLimitPriceOfMKTOrder(Stock stock,
                                                   OrderDirection orderDirection)

        This method is calculating the desiredLimitPrice for the current MKT Order, based on its OrderDirection.

        The method searches if there are opposite Direction already placed Orders in the given Stock's data-base.

        If there are such opposite already placed Orders, the method calculates the desiredLimitPrice of the MKT Order to be as the first opposite already placed Order's desiredLimitPrice.

        If there are no such opposite already placed Orders, the method calculates the desiredLimitPrice of the MKT Order to be as the current price of the given Stock.

        Parameters:
        stock - the current Stock to deal with.
        orderDirection - the current MKT Order's Direction.
        Returns:
        the calculated desiredLimitPrice of the current MKT Order.

      • insertUserForced

        public static void insertUserForced(User user)
        Inserts a User to the users field. In case the users field is null, then initialize it and insert the given User.
        Parameters:
